Hi Rob,


Actually, -ar 0 just turns off the limit to value spacing, so you'll  
basically get one interreflection calculation per pixel on inside  
corners.  Interpolation still takes place when surfaces are farther  
apart.  To turn off interpolation altogether, you'd have to set -aa  
0, which is another (somewhat more drastic) approach to the scaling  
problem.


-Greg
